page.title: 20FUTURE FOR THE AIRPORT AREA
page.content: In the current economic climate, none of the industrial or agricultural uses of the land are in decline. The airport hopes to{expand},the chemical works has been able to{adapt}to a new form of transport whilst the farmers are{benefitting}from EEC subsidies. West Cleveland is becoming a more popular place to live, with many new housing developments. At the present time, our survey block has not seen any of this development, but it could become the major{pressure on the land in the future. {************************************** Mr K.D.Allan and Miss D.Houseman of {Egglescliffe School,}would like to thank the pupils of 3RA and 3NW for their help in compiling the text information, and members of the Sixth Form for the land use survey. .
